intro: Schizoloma malabaricum, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a rough texture, and its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
